text:
under apache 2.0.49 when mod_deflate works in the "compress all" mode by adding

SetInputFilter DEFLATE

it will ignore the exclusion directives such as 

SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \.(?:zip)$ no-gzip dont-vary

and improperly gzip some already compressed content such as .zip files and 
corrupt them. tested and proved with internet explorer 5-6.

the above exclusion does appear to work because if a "HEAD" command is issued 
the returned header does not include a Vary header. however the files are 
actually corrupted.
creator: mike@hostvision.net

text:
Can you please attach a complete set of header (in and out) of such a request?
Thanks.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
Both 2.0.49 and 2.1.0 look fine to me.  In the absence of a reply to André's
request for details, there seems no point in keeping it open.
creator: nick@webthing.com
